bibl.title: Popular Violence and the Stability of Roman Alexandria, 30 BC-AD 215. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Suggests a revisionist interpretation: the conventional view of an Alexandria out of control cannot stand on the current body of evidence. - Alexandrian Disturbances from Augustus's Conquest to Caracalla's Massacre, 30 BC-AD 215. - Comparanda: Roman Riots from Octavian to Vespasian, 31 BC-AD 69. - Discussion. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Alexandrian Studies in memoriam Daoud Abdu Daoud

bibl.seg: BARRY William D., Popular Violence and the Stability of Roman Alexandria, 30 BC-AD 215. Avec résumé en anglais.
Alexandrian Studies in memoriam Daoud Abdu Daoud = BSAA 45 (1993) pp. 19-34.

Suggests a revisionist interpretation: the conventional view of an Alexandria out of control cannot stand on the current body of evidence. - Alexandrian Disturbances from Augustus's Conquest to Caracalla's Massacre, 30 BC-AD 215. - Comparanda: Roman Riots from Octavian to Vespasian, 31 BC-AD 69. - Discussion. - Conclusion.
